title-group.article-title: Factorization of the Tenth Fermat Number

abstract.p: We describe the complete factorization of the tenth Fermat number F<sub>10</sub> by the elliptic curve method (ECM). F<sub>10</sub> is a product of four prime factors with 8, 10, 40 and 252 decimal digits. The 40-digit factor was found after about 140 Mflop-years of computation. We also discuss the complete factorization of other Fermat numbers by ECM, and summarize the factorizations of F<sub>5</sub>,..., F<sub>11</sub>.
